div.span: Adapted from Inventory of Greek Coin Hoards

div.pre: 1411 Asia Minor, central, 1963 Burial: c. 190 B.C. (Boehringer) Contents: c. 400 AR Lot A Alexander III: 21 late post. tetradr. (Ca- byle 1, Miletus 1, Chios 2, Rhodes 2, Phaselis 2, Aspendus 3, Perge 5 to yr. 29, Termessus ? 1, Aradus 1 of yr. 43, unc. mints 3) Antigonus Doson: 1 tetradr. Prusias I: 2 tetradr. Attalus I: 1 tetradr. Side: 3 tetradr. Antiochus II: 2 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 1, Aegae 1) Antiochus III: 8 tetradr. (Ecbatana 3, Nisibis 1, Antiocheia 1, Tarsus 2, unc. as WSM 1687 1) Lot B Alexander III: 7 late post. tetradr. (Per- gamum 3, Phaselis 1, Perge 2, unc. mint 1) Antigonus Gonatas: 1 tetradr. Lysimachus: 1 lifetime tetradr. (Perga- mum) Eumenes I: 1 tetradr. Attalus I: 6 tetradr. Side: 2 tetradr. Antiochus II: 1 tetradr. (Antiocheia) Seleucus II: 1 tetradr. (Apameia) Antiochus Hierax: 2 tetradr. (Sardes Alexandreia Troas 1) Seleucus III: 4 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Ti- grim 1, Antiocheia 2, unc. mint 1) Antiochus III: 6 tetradr. (Antiocheia 5, Apameia 1) Lot C Alexander III: 4 late post. tetradr. (Aspen- dus, Perge) Lysimachus: 1 lifetime tetradr. (Ephesus) Prusias I: 1 tetradr. Attains I: 1 tetradr. Seleucus II: 1 tetradr. (Tarsus ?) Antiochus Hierax: 1 tetradr. (Alexandreia Troas) Antiochus III: 2 tetradr. (Seleuceia ad Tigrim 1, Nisibis 1) Disposition: dispersed Boehringer, Zur Chronologie, pp. 172- 9, illus. (Lots A-B) Information from A. Spaer (Lot C) The three lots, although separately re- corded, seem to belong to the same hd. The provenance is given as "Pisidia" (Lot A), "Phrygia ?" (Lot C), and "Asia Minor" (Lot B), while the date in all three cases is 1963
